    1. Become a Crowd User
Vintage Social Media

Subject to change as the term progresses.

Date Topic Readings
Aug 27 Intro Lecture
  • Relationship between crowdsourcing, human computation, collective intelligence, data mining, social computing
  • Examples of crowdsourcing and human computation
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Introduction and Chapter 1
  • Harnessing Crowds: Mapping the Genome of Collective Intelligence by Malone, Laubacher, and Dellarocas
  • Vox Populi by Sir Francis Galton
  • Why did people lose their minds over Beanie Babies? by Slate Magazine
Sep 01 Labor Day (no classes)
  • My MTurk (half) Workday by Jeff Bigham
  • The MIT Living Wage Calculator by Amy Glasmeier
Sep 03 The Mechanical Turk crowdsourcing platform - part 1
  • Working on Mechanical Turk, demographics of Mechanical Turk workers, estimating the size of the Mechanical Turk Marketplace
  • Terminology and mechanics: Turkers, Requesters, HITs, micropayments
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 2 ("The Difference Difference Makes")
  • The Demographics of MTurk by Panos Ipeirotis
  • Being A Turker by David Martin, Benjamin Hanrahan, Jacki Oâ€™Neill and Neha Gupta
  • Turkopticon: Interrupting Worker Invisibility in Amazon Mechanical Turk by Lilly Irani and Six Silberman
  • Amazon Mechanical Turk: Gold Mine or Coal Mine? by Karen Fort, Gilles Adda and Bretonnel Cohen
Sep 08 The Mechanical Turk crowdsourcing platform - part 2
  • Amazon Mechanical Turk from the Requester's perspective: Designing HITs, qualifications, pricing HITs, approving/rejecting
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 3 ("Monkey See, Monkey Do")
  • Requester Tour of Mechanical Turk
  • Mechanical Turk blog
Sep 10 Taxonomy of crowdsourcing and human computation
  • Categorization system: motivation, quality control, aggregation, human skill, process flow
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 4 ("Putting the Pieces Together")
  • Human Computation: A Survey and Taxonomy of a Growing Field by Alex Quinn and Ben Bederson
  • Worker Evaluation in Crowdsourcing: Gold Data or Multiple Workers? by Panos Ipeirotis
  • Python tutorials and references
Sep 15 Machine Learning part 1
  • Examples of machine learning applications
  • Bayes Rule
  • Reasoning with Probabilities
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 5 ("Shall We Dance?: Coordination in a Complex World")
  • Intro to Machine Learning in Python by Hilary Mason
Sep 17 Machine Learning - part 2
  • Labeled training data - what it is, where to get it, and how to put it in a format that a classifier will be able to use
  • Walkthrough of building a classifier in Python
  • We do the homework in front of your eyes
  • Experiment design - training / test splits, overfitting, baselines, evaluation
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 6 ("Society Does Exist: Taxes, Tipping, Television and Trust")
  • scikit-learn: Machine Learning in Python (webpage with tutorials)
  • Scikit-learn: Machine Learning in Python (short article in the Journal of Machine Learning Research) by Fabian Pedregosa and 15 others
Sep 22 Programming concepts for human computation
  • People as function calls, decomposing complex tasks into simpler subtasks
  • Memoizataion of expensive function calls, "Crash and Re-Run"
  • Quicksort for kittens
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 7 ("Traffic: What We Have Here is a Failure to Communicate")
  • TurKit: Human Computation Algorithms on Mechanical Turk by Greg Little, Lydia B. Chilton, Max Goldman, and Robert C. Miller
  • Download the TurKit software from the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
Sep 24 Iterative and Parallel Processing
  • Experiments with TurKit
  • Iterative versus parallel processing
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 7 ("Traffic: What We Have Here is a Failure to Communicate")
  • Exploring Iterative and Parallel Human Computation Processes by Greg Little, Lydia B. Chilton, Max Goldman, and Robert C. Miller
  • Download the TurKit software from the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
Sep 29 Firearm Violence: A Public Health Issue by Douglas Wiebe, Associate Professor of Epidemiology, University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine
  • Firearm injury as a public health issue
  • Importance of data in epidemiology
  • Firearm Injury in the U.S. 2011 Resource Book by FICAP
  • Gun Violence Research and Prevention by Charles Branas and Douglas Wiebe
Oct 01 Crowdsourcing and human computer interaction (HCI) design by Ellie Pavlick (Instructor will be traveling)
  • Next generation interfaces
  • Soylent word processor ("it's made of people")
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 6 ("Society Does Exist: Taxes, Tipping, Television and Trust")
  • Soylent: A Word Processor with a Crowd Inside by Michael Bernstein, Greg Little, Rob Miller, BjoÌˆrn Hartmann, Mark Ackerman, David Karger, David Crowell, and Katrina Panovich

  • E-mail Valet
  • Adrenaline
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 7 ("Traffic: What We Have Here is a Failure to Communicate")
  • Crowds in Two Seconds: Enabling Realtime Crowd-Powered Interfaces by Michael Bernstein, Joel Brandt, Rob Miller, and David Karger
  • EmailValet: Managing Email Overload through Private, Accountable Crowdsourcing by Nicolas Kokkalis, Thomas KoÌˆhn, Carl Pfeiffer, Dima Chornyi, Michael Bernstein, and Scott Klemmer
Oct 08 In-class presentations: Pitch your term project ideas
Oct 13 In-class presentations: Pitch your term project ideas
Oct 15 No class today. Instructor and TA will be traveling for a DARPA meeting.
Oct 20 Quality Control part 1
  • Agreement-based methods
  • Embedded gold standard
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 7 ("Traffic: What We Have Here is a Failure to Communicate")
  • Labeling Images with a Computer Game by Luis von Ahn and Laura Dabbish

  • Economic incentives
  • Reputation systems
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 8 ("Science: Collaboration, Competition and Reputation")
  • Opinion Mining Using Econometrics: A Case Study on Reputation Systems by Anindya Ghose, Panos Ipeirotis, and Arun Sundararajan

Oct 27 Quality Control part 3
  • More on reputation systems
  • The EM algorithm
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 8 ("Science: Collaboration, Competition and Reputation")
  • Maximum Likelihood Estimation of Observer Error-Rates Using the EM Algorithm by A. P. Dawid and A. M. Skene
  • Get Another Label? Improving Data Quality and Data Mining Using Multiple, Noisy Labelers by Victor Sheng, Foster Provost, and Panos Ipeirotis
  • An Evening with EM (a tutorial on EM) by Dirk Hovy
Oct 29 Decision-Theoretic Crowdsourcing by Mausam
  • Human Intelligence Needs Artificial Intelligence by Dan Weld, Mausam, and Peng Dai
  • POMDP-based Control of Workflows for Crowdsourcing by Peng Dai, Chris Lin, Mausam, and Dan Weld
Nov 03 Prediction Markets by Ellie Pavlick
Nov 05 Distilling Collective Intelligence from Twitter part 1
  • Topic Detection and Tracking
  • Approximate algorithms for scaling to large data sets
  • The Wisdom of Crowds: Chapter 12 ("Democracy: Dreams of the Common Good")
  • Streaming First Story Detection with application to Twitter by Sasa Petrovic, Miles Osborne, and Victor Lavrenko
  • Online Generation of Locality Sensitive Hash Signatures by Ben Van Durme and Ashwin Lall
  • Approximate Nearest Neighbors: Towards Removing the Curse of Dimensionality by Sariel Har-Peled, Piotr Indyk and Rajeev Motwani
Nov 10 Distilling Collective Intelligence from Twitter part 2
  • Public health and Twitter
  • You are what you Tweet: Analyzing Twitter for Public Health by Michael Paul and Mark Dredze
Nov 12 Crowdsourcing Translation
  • The language demographics of Mechanical Turk
  • Using crowdsourcing to collect data to train SMT systems
  • Crowdsourcing Translation: Professional Quality from Non-Professionals by Omar Zaidan and Chris Callison-Burch
  • The Language Demographics of Amazon Mechanical Turk by Ellie Pavlick, Matt Post, Ann Irvine, Dmitry Kachaev, and Chris Callison-Burch
  • Machine Translation of Arabic Dialects by Rabih Zbib, Erika Malchiodi, Jacob Devlin, David Stallard, Spyros Matsoukas, Richard Schwartz, John Makhoul, Omar F. Zaidan, and Chris Callison-Burch
Nov 17 Crowdsourcing for Automatic Speech Recognition
  • A high level overview of automatic speech recognition
  • Using crowdsourcing to train ASR systems
  • Cheap, Fast and Good Enough: Automatic Speech Recognition with Non-Expert Transcription by Scott Novotney and Chris Callison-Burch
  • Crowdsourcing for Speech Processing: Applications to Data Collection, Transcription and Assessment
Nov 19 Social Sciences and Human Subjects Research
  • Human subjects research
  • Social Science experiments
  • Amazon's Mechanical Turk - A New Source of Inexpensive, Yet High-Quality, Data? by Michael Buhrmester, Tracy Kwang and Samuel Gosling
  • Using Mechanical Turk to Study Clinical Populations by Danielle N. Shapiro, Jesse Chandler, Pam A. Mueller
  • Penn's Institutional Review Board
Nov 26 No class (Friday class schedule today)
Dec 01 A/B Testing
  • Active versus passive crowdsourcing
  • Making money with statistics
  • Optimizing web sites using A/B testing
  • Are you part of a social experiment?
  • The A/B Test: Inside the Technology Thatâ€™s Changing the Rules of Business by Wired Magazine

  • Effective A/B Testing by Ben Tilly
  • Optimizely

  • TLDR by TLDR podcast
  • We Experiment On Human Beings! by Christian Rudder - OKCupid
Dec 03 Expert Crowds
  • Finding people with obscure knowledge via ads
  • Creating and evaluating test questions
  • Quizz: Targeted Crowdsourcing with a Billion (Potential) Users by Panos Ipeirotis and Evgeniy Gabrilovich
  • STEP: A Scalable Testing and Evaluation Platform by Maria Christoforaki and Panos Ipeirotis
Dec 08 Course wrap-up
